credibility_factors.procurement_standards: US Government procurement requires rigorous vendor qualification and independent verification
credibility_factors.oversight: Multiple layers of oversight including facility managers, energy managers, and DoD protocols
credibility_factors.accountability: Government installations have strict reporting requirements and audit trails
credibility_factors.replicability: Multiple installations across different branches and locations show consistent results
credibility_factors.independent_validation: CEM (Certified Energy Manager) certification on Military Base A validates methodology

implications_for_corpus_credibility.rationale: Government/military validation represents the highest tier of credibility - these installations have no incentive to falsify results and operate under strict accountability standards
implications_for_corpus_credibility.combined_with_existing: When combined with 6 independent labs, 125 PE-certified field studies, UL-verified methodology, and specialized proprietary expertise, this brings corpus credibility to 10/10

key_points: 5 government/military facilities across 4 states validated PermaFrost NMR
7 separate studies covering heat pumps, chillers, CRAC, split systems, and refrigerated transport
Multiple branches: Air Force, DoD, Air National Guard, National Guard, County Government
All studies show positive efficiency improvements ranging from 12.5% to 39%
Payback periods range from 9-14 months across government installations
CEM (Certified Energy Manager) independently verified Military Base A heat pump study
IPMVP Option B methodology used consistently across studies
